alert.note: Alert for Southern Lake, North Shore (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 22 at 2:36PM CST until February 23 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 PM CST THURSDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON CST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero. * WHERE...Southern Lake County. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 6 PM this evening to 6 PM CST Thursday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 11 PM this evening to noon CST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Road conditions can also be found at 511mn.org for Minnesota or 511wi.gov for Wisconsin.
